name: Commode
description: Commode; Bernard II van Risenburgh (French, after 1696 - about 1766, master before 1730); Paris, France; about 1737; Oak set with panels of black Japanese lacquer and painted with vernis Martin; veneered with cherry and amaranth on interior of the doors; gilt-bronze mounts; sarrancolin marble top; eighteenth-century silk fabric lining and silver metal galon; 88.3 x 151.9 x 57.8 cm (34 3/4 x 59 13/16 x 22 3/4 in.); 65.DA.4; Gift of J. Paul Getty; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Commode
medium: Oak set with panels of black Japanese lacquer and painted with vernis Martin; veneered with cherry and amaranth on interior of the doors; gilt-bronze mounts; sarrancolin marble top; eighteenth-century silk fabric lining and silver metal galon
